author: jellylikepie

author: Yoda____
title: finishing my JS reviews well
review: I actually quite like this one, like every other Jack Stone set that I've reviewed it has the same flaw and advantage but to find out just read my police cruiser review. this one has a cool chain and it can tow any other Jack Stone car and it has a few other nice features and pieces.

author: BobaFett2
title: One of the best Jack Stone sets-but still, not that much
review:
Of all the Jack Stone sets, this is probably one of the best. The sole reason is for it's parts.

Box/Instructions

The Res-Q Wrecker is displayed with cartoony mountains as a background. Simple and boring.

Parts

The set costs 20 cents per part-not a good price. However, it has quite a few nice parts-such as the windscreen, chain, ball hook, and race car back. However, the parts are over-juniorized.

Minifigures

The Minifigure is detailed and has texture, but unfortunately, it's pretty bad. It's too big and the hands don't rotate, and it is simply out of place in a LEGO world.

The build

There's really nothing. It's better than in some sets of the theme, but it's really nothing.

The completed model

It looks good, but it's not actually that great. It is functional, with a tow arm, (how is this a wrecker?), and bumper, but the large parts' aesthetics just aren't that good.

Summary

This is probably the most worthwhile Jack Stone set to get. It's not very good, but it has quite a few nice parts. Still....it's over juniorized with nearly no build whatsoever, has a large figure that's more of a doll than a Minifigure (doesn't come apart, can only hold accessories), and doesn't fit the name.
